conclusion: Ensure the device is set up as shown in the image with container C connected to U-tube D via tube B, and a movable piston K in container C.
Measure the initial volume of air in the container C by noting the initial position of the piston K.
Carefully place the irregularly shaped solid into the container C ensuring it is fully inside without any part sticking out.
Observe the movement of the piston K after placing the solid due to the displacement of air by the solid.
Measure the final position of the piston K after the solid has been placed to get the new volume of air in the container.
Calculate the volume of the solid as the difference between the initial and final volumes of air in the container.
Record the initial and final positions of the piston K to determine the volume change accurately.
The volume of the solid is the volume of air displaced, which is the difference between the initial and final volumes of air in the container C.
